Reviews.Title: descent for the $$
Reviews.Author: N-da-O
Reviews.Content: I actually own the L22W861.  I bought the L22W761 but quickly realized that it was more of a computer monitor than a TV.  Check out [...] for more info.One thing that is common between the 861 and 761 is that the sound is awful.  If you have the 761 that is easily remedied by plugging in an inexpensive set of computer speakers for $20-30.  However the headphone jack on the 861 is INPUT ONLY??!!  After contacting AOC the only option on the 861 for audio out is SPDIF. (digital audio) Well that's great if you want to sink another $150-200 into a sound system that has SPDIF input.Regardless I still went w/ the 861 b/c it has more TV like features.  For example, there is a "LAST" button on the tv remote so you can switch between the last channel viewed.  Check out the OWNERS MANUAL for each on the AOC website.The picture is nice on both sets.  This size tv works well for a small room or niche area.If you can buy this for under $250 I'd say it's a "go".  Overall I'm pleased with the performance after a couple months.Best regards.

480i, 480p, 720p and 1080i input capable - By law, California shipments of this product are subject to an $16.00 Electronic Waste Recycling Fee
